alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Tangipahoa; St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:40AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Helena, northern Livingston, southwestern Tangipahoa and south central East Baton Rouge Parishes through 915 AM CDT... At 840 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Denham Springs, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Hammond, Denham Springs, Ponchatoula, Walker, Amite City, Livingston, Independence, Albany, Springfield, Natalbany, Shenandoah, Old Jefferson and Tickfaw. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 8 and 42. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 27 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Tangipahoa; St. Helena
